item.description:
Everyone (myself included) that went on this group's recent Star Island trip loved it so much that requests for a return trip keep coming in.

You ask - you get.

Weather and equipment permitting, this is your chance to return to Star Island on the last day it is open for the season - Sunday, September 25th.

Arrive in Rye by 8:30AM, board at 9AM, and we take off at 9:15, arriving at Star Island at 10AM. You'll have five and half hours (a perfect amount of time) to get hundreds of great photos on this jewel of an island.

The return trip leaves the island at 3:30PM, arriving back in Rye before 5PM.

Weather on the NH seas in late September is unpredictable. Bring gear for a warm day that may turn very cold and bitter - in other words, bring layers.

If we're lucky enough to get blue skies and puffy white clouds - and why shouldn't we in New England's finest season? - bring a polarizing filter if you have one.

There will be something for everyone - birds starting migrations, blue seas, rough landscapes, interesting weathered buildings (inside and out), a New England hotel, rock and water interplay, monuments, a graveyard - the list goes on and on.

Seats are limited, and we'll be sharing this trip with the Seacoast group. If the trip is cancelled, you'll be refunded. If you cancel, please try to find someone to take your spot and pay you: we will probably not be able to refund you in that case. Possible, but not probable.
item.how_to_find_us: Come to the boat, we'll be waiting there before launch.
item.name: Star Island Photo-Palooza Day Trip
